result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:02 AM Defendant Myron Drew Lemieux in court.  Attorney Brian Thomas Stevens appeared by video for Myron Drew Lemieux.  Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Through Attorney, DEF waives time limits for Preliminary hearing.  DEF agrees.  Bond Continues.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:37 AM  DEF Myron Drew Lemieux in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) appears by video. Jennifer Gross appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty argues bond.  Court sets bond. SIBS $1500 ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.  Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for 8/2/2022 at 8:30AM.
